descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of dilations, translations, rotations, or reflections.
Student can identify at least one transformation (dilation, translation, rotation, or reflection) but struggles with the concept.
Student can identify and describe at least two transformations but has difficulty applying them in coordinate geometry.
Student can describe dilations, translations, rotations, and reflections but struggles with accurately representing them using coordinates.
Student accurately describes and applies dilations, translations, rotations, and reflections on two-dimensional figures using coordinates, but with minor errors.

Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of transformations, accurately describing and applying dilations, translations, rotations, and reflections on two-dimensional figures using coordinates.
Student cannot use coordinates to represent transformations.
Student attempts to use coordinates but demonstrates little to no accuracy.
Student can use coordinates to represent simple transformations (e.g., translations) but struggles with more complex ones (e.g., rotations).
Student can represent most transformations using coordinates but makes errors in calculations or notation.
Student accurately represents transformations using coordinates, with only minor errors or omissions.
Student demonstrates mastery in using coordinates to represent transformations, with no errors and clear, precise notation.
Student does not understand how transformations affect two-dimensional figures.
Student demonstrates some awareness of how transformations affect figures but cannot describe the effects accurately.
Student can describe the effects of some transformations on figures but struggles with more complex cases or combinations of transformations.
Student can describe the effects of transformations on figures but may make errors in describing the changes in size, shape, or orientation.
Student accurately describes the effects of transformations on figures, with only minor errors or omissions.
Student demonstrates a deep understanding of how transformations affect two-dimensional figures, accurately describing changes in size, shape, orientation, and position.
